headline.main: The 'Death Blow' to Herbalife Promised by William Ackman Falls Short of Its Billing
headline.print_headline: The ‘Death Blow’ to Herbalife Promised by William Ackman Falls Short of Its Billing

docs.abstract: The hedge fund billionaire William A. Ackman spent more than three hours trying to convince everyone who would listen that Herbalife is a fraud. Its stock rose more than 25 percent.
docs.snippet: The hedge fund billionaire William A. Ackman spent more than three hours trying to convince everyone who would listen that Herbalife is a fraud. Its stock rose more than 25 percent.

byline.original: By WILLIAM ALDEN and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire investor William Ackman's latest volley of accusations against Herbalife Ltd on Tuesday missed its mark on Wall Street, with investors sending the stock price soaring 25 percent.

headline.main: Wall Street Rejects Ackman's Herbalife 'Death Blow'
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Rejects Ackman's Herbalife 'Death Blow'

docs.snippet: Billionaire investor William Ackman's latest volley of accusations against Herbalife Ltd on Tuesday missed its mark on Wall Street, with investors sending the stock price soaring 25 percent.

docs.lead_paragraph: John DeSimone, the chief financial officer of Herbalife, says that the activist investor William Ackman is missing the real analysis of the nutrition supplement company.

headline.sub: Herbalife CFO lashes out at Bill Ackman's attacks

docs.snippet: John DeSimone, the chief financial officer of Herbalife, says that the activist investor William Ackman is missing the real analysis of the nutrition supplement company.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday as some positive earnings and economic data pointed to a market that still had room to rise despite the S&P 500 hitting an intraday record.

headline.main: Wall St. Gains on Earnings, Data; Conflicts Still Eyed
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Gains on Earnings, Data; Conflicts Still Eyed

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday as some positive earnings and economic data pointed to a market that still had room to rise despite the S&P 500 hitting an intraday record.

docs.lead_paragraph: Focaccia, a little crisp on the bottom but soft on the top and inside, can take on many toppings besides tomatoes.

headline.main: Whole Wheat Focaccia With Tomatoes and Fontina
headline.print_headline: A Slice of Tomato Adds Life to Focaccia

docs.abstract: Martha Rose Shulman Recipes for Health column presents a recipe for whole wheat focaccia with tomatoes and fontina cheese.
docs.snippet: Focaccia, a little crisp on the bottom but soft on the top and inside, can take on many toppings besides tomatoes.
